User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)

There's two mouse-click ways to exit a tab; upper-right "X" and upper-left icon. The upper-left exit has a very nice warning that you are about to close Firefox. The upper-right exit just exits Firefox without warning.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open a second tab
2.click on the upper-left (the Firefox icon) to exit that tab
3.Open up another tab but this time click on the upper-right (the "X").  
Actual Results:  
There's no warning. It just exits.  You now have to find the Firefox icon and restart it.

Expected Results:  
Everyone who uses IE is expecting the warning to show up there too.
